meanings.definition: To run with quick, hasty steps
meanings.sent1: The rabbit scuttled across the field to escape the fox.
meanings.sent2: The children scuttled to the playground when the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scuttled up the tree with the acorn, looking mischievous.
meanings.sent4: Time scuttled away like sand slipping through fingers.
meanings.sent5: The mouse scuttled through the maze, searching for cheese.

meanings.definition: To sink a ship deliberately by opening seacocks or making holes in the hull
meanings.sent1: The pirates scuttled the enemy ship to prevent capture.
meanings.sent2: The captain scuttled the old vessel to claim insurance money.
meanings.sent3: The sailors scuttled the ship in a daring move to outsmart their pursuers.
meanings.sent4: The decision to scuttle the ship was made to protect valuable cargo.
meanings.sent5: The crew scuttled the ship under the cover of darkness, leaving no trace.

meanings.definition: To cut a hole in the bottom of a ship to sink it
meanings.sent1: The traitor scuttled the ship to sabotage the mission.
meanings.sent2: The enemy agent scuttled the vessel to prevent it from reaching port.
meanings.sent3: The captain scuttled the ship as a last resort to avoid capture.
meanings.sent4: The crew had to scuttle the ship to prevent it from falling into enemy hands.
meanings.sent5: The decision to scuttle the ship was a difficult but necessary one.
